snippet.textDisplay: Actually, regardless of where you're from, you can experience freedom in China. But, as the saying goes in the West, 'freedom isn't free', and in China, freedom comes with its own set of boundaries. Take note, as a foreigner in China, it‚Äôs crucial not to hide behind the guise of religion or curiosity to discuss or meddle in their political system, leaders, or history. Anyone well-versed in Chinese history understands that the country has faced its share of turmoil in recent times, making certain topics particularly sensitive. Different from the West, the Chinese hold their leaders in high regard, as they are seen as the bearers of the nation's hopes for revival. With its one-party system, the leadership in China is akin to a patriarch in a family, and their primary focus right now is progress. Too many cooks spoil the broth, and too many opinions can lead to chaos. So, whether you work there or just visiting, keep in mind that it‚Äôs best to steer clear of discussions about their national systems, especially since it doesn‚Äôt concern you. All in all, if you show them kindness, expect it to be returned tenfold. Here‚Äôs to hoping that everyone visiting China has an amazing time!

snippet.textDisplay: Welcome but just for information it is not a new year for Muslim it is a festival after the completion of holy month Ramadan . It is a gift for us after fasting for 29 or 30 days .  It is a 3 day event and in all Muslims countries it is the major holiday. Islamic new year start after nearly 3 months according to lunar calendar. After this event we get the next Eid in the last month of lunar calendar on the date of 10 of Zilhajj ( the last month name).
snippet.textOriginal: Welcome but just for information it is not a new year for Muslim it is a festival after the completion of holy month Ramadan . It is a gift for us after fasting for 29 or 30 days .  It is a 3 day event and in all Muslims countries it is the major holiday. Islamic new year start after nearly 3 months according to lunar calendar. After this event we get the next Eid in the last month of lunar calendar on the date of 10 of Zilhajj ( the last month name).

snippet.textDisplay: Eid Al-Fitr is a celebrating day after finished fasting full 1 month. It's consider holiday in Muslim Majority country or country who have significant Muslim population like India. Even some city in the West like New York consider as school holiday.

AbdurRahman ibn AbuLayla, quoting Usayd ibn Hudayr, a man of the Ansar, said that while he was given to jesting and was talking to the people and making them laugh, the Prophet (Ô∑∫) poked him under the ribs with a stick.
